medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had been in her usual health until 4 days earlier when, upon awakening, she was unable to open her left eye. There was no periorbital swelling, discharge, pruritus, blurred or double vision, or weakness of her limbs. The symptoms progressed with issues like neck stiffness and increased fatigue over the following weeks.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, hyperlipidemia, atherosclerosis, osteoporosis, kyphosis due to degenerative spinal disease, and complete heart block, for which a permanent pacemaker had been inserted 5 years previously. Past medical history includes herpes zoster and laparoscopic cholecystectomy.
medical_history.social_history: Single, retired, lived independently, performed all activities of daily living, occasionally drank alcohol, and did not smoke or use illicit drugs.
